sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
If it is given that \((10 c ^2 - 18 d ^2 ):(cd ) = 3 : 1 \). Find the ratio of \(c : d \).
\newline
", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "It is given that 
\[
	(10 c ^2 - 18 d ^2 ):(cd ) = 3 : 1 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{\input[s1v1]{} c ^2 - 18 d ^2 }{cd } = \frac{3}{1}
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	10 c ^2 - 18 d ^2 = \input[s2v1]{} cd 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow 10 c ^2 - (\input[s3v1]{} )cd - 18 d ^2 = 0
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 10 c ^2 -3cd - 18 d ^2 = 0
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow 10 c ^2 + \input[s4v1]{} cd - \input[s4v2]{} cd - 18 d ^2 = 0
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow 2c (\input[s5v1]{}c + \input[s5v2]{}d) - 3d (5c + 6d) = 0
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow (5 c + 6 d )(2 c - 3 d ) = 0
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow (5 c + \input[s6v1]{} d ) = 0 \text{ or} (\input[s6v2]{} c - 3 d ) = 0
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "

\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{c }{d } = \frac{-6 }{\input[s7v1]{} }
\]
Or, 
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{c }{d } = \frac{\input[s7v2]{} }{2 }
\]
\newline
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [10], "text": "$$\text{The expression $ (10 c ^2 - 18 d ^2 ):(cd ) = 3 : 1 $ can be written as $ \frac{10 c ^2 - 18 d ^2 }{cd } = \frac{3}{1} $}.$$"}, {"data": [3], "text": "$$\text{Upon cross_multiplication and simplification we get $ 10 c ^2 - 18 d ^2 = 3 cd $}$$"}, {"data": [3], "text": "$$\text{Bringing all the terms on the left hand side we get $ 10 c ^2 - (3 )cd - 18 d ^2 = 0$ which can be written as $10 c ^2 -3cd - 18 d ^2 = 0$.}$$"}, {"data": [12, 15], "text": "$$\text{ Upon finding factors the exprssion can be written as $ 10 c ^2 + 12 cd - 15 cd - 18 d ^2 = 0 $}$$ "}, {"data": [5, 6], "text": "$$\text{Upon taking common factors out we get $ (5 c + 6 d )(2 c - 3 d ) = 0 $}$$ "}, {"data": [6, 2], "text": "$$\text{Any factor can be zero, thereforee, $ (5 c + 6 d ) = 0$ or $(2 c - 3 d ) = 0 $}$$ "}, {"data": [5, 3], "text": "$$\text{Upon simplifying the two equalities we get $\frac{c }{d } = \frac{-6 }{5 }$ or $\frac{c }{d } = \frac{3 }{2 }$}$$ "}]
